text: It's my first year in Rennes 2 and in communication. A year ago, I was lost in my orientation and I did'nt know where to go to study after having my "baccalauréat". I had maths and LLCER english as specialities last year in high school just because I had rather good grades, not for my future orientation. So I saw a lot of people during my three year of high school to help me find my way. At first, people wanted me to go in music or art school because these are my passions. But I wasn't really sure about it and I wanted to keep my passions as passions and not as studies. A month before the "Parcoursup" inscription, I saw a woman, Alex Dupont, who wanted to help me find my way not by knowing my passions but by knowing my personality. She surprised me because she wasn't like the others and really helped me. As I was talking with her (she talked a lot but it's okay because I'm shy), so she talked and discovered by my parents studies and how and where I grew up that three ways were for me: psychology, art and sociology. She said that psychology would be a good way for me but because I'm hypersensitive it could be hard. At this time, I was drawing a lot just for fun and by the way I liked to add hidden messages in my drawings. One time, I showed her some of my drawings and she asked me if I knew the Communication Licence. I didn't know what it was so I did a lot of researches and I told myself "Why not?". So, after this, I went to a lot of presentations of info com and near to where I live, it was all private school which cost a lot of money and my family couldn't afford that. I went visiting Paris but this licence wasn't here anymore since a long time. So, when I searched in Paris for a communication licence in university, I found Rennes 2 University. My house is 150km far from here so I wasn't really sure about going to this city. When Marine called me an evening, I told her about this and she helped me thinking better about "starting a new life". Unfortunately, I wasn't in good relations with my friends in high school so, going far from them, because a lot of people in my school were going in Paris or Paris, could be a great idea. It was hard to choose but when the "Parcoursup" resultats were out, I partically immediately chose the only licence I wanted in Paris: I was going to study in information and communication.
